posts.name: Sasha Weiss
posts.cooked:
Today, we’re releasing version 7.76 to beta. If you’re interested in participating, join the beta group.

Release notes:

  • Now you can tap on a name in the calls tab to view additional information instead of immediately starting a new call with that contact. There’s still a shortcut to quickly call someone back too, but whether or not you use it is entirely your call.

Let us know about any issues you experience! Thank you for being a beta tester!

link_counts.title: Beta feedback for the upcoming iOS 7.75 release

posts.cooked:
New Version: 7.76.0.996-beta

41 new commits since 7.75.0.989-beta (+ 1 commit omitted):

Show commits

  • Bump version to 7.76 [1]

  • Enable Backups for internal builds [2]

  • Schema for polls [3]

  • Switch to Xcode 26.0 [4] (reverted by [41])

  • NO MORE REST [5]

  • Debounce BackupExportJob progress updates to 10Hz [6]

  • Use .monospacedDigit for progress bar subtitles [7]

  • Complete BackupArchiveExport OWSProgress after export completes [8]

  • Don't archive quote text if empty after trimming [9]

  • Consolidate Backup Settings progress bars [10]

  • Don't block on thumbnail attachment upload [11]

  • Clean up list media integrity check result storage [12]

  • Fix Xcode 26 builds on CI [13] (reverted by [40])

  • Set dataSource before message body in gif approval [14]

  • Re-add configuring cell backgrounds to OWSTableItem.configureCell [15]

  • Run the BackupBGProcessingTask nightly, regardless of manual Backups [16]

  • Add poll store and poll manager to interact with poll database tables [17]

  • Cache BackupServiceAuth [18]

  • Improve backup thumbnail webp generation perf [19]

  • Remove misleading comment and unnecessary wrapping [20]

  • Design feedback on "View Backup Key" [21]

  • Only set the Backup-ID on the primary [22]

  • Don’t restore groups during registration [23]

  • Expose the last Backup file size separately in Internal Settings [24]

  • Remove unnecessary profile commitment check [25]

  • Remove global accesses from dedupeSignalRecipients [26]

  • Simplify parameters when building device messages [27]

  • Refactor message building to allow parallelization [28]

  • Parallelize pre key fetches [29]

  • Track completed unit count for backup attachment upload progress [30]

  • Don't allow list media integrity check to race with backup uploads [31]

  • Filter QueuedBackupAttachmentUpload rows by ready for internal settings display [32]

  • Remove outdated comment about UAKs [33]

  • Remove outdated comment about error handling [34]

  • Fix false positive GSE errors [35]

  • Add dedicated "low power mode" paused case for Backup upload/download [36]

  • Hex-encode data blobs returned from internal SQL queries [37]

  • Update release notes [38]

  • Update translations [39]

  • Revert "Fix Xcode 26 builds on CI" [40] (reverts [13])

  • Revert "Switch to Xcode 26.0" [41] (reverts [4])

posts.name: fr33tux
posts.cooked:
Hello,

A relative is facing an issue right on opening Signal. It happens everytime, even on airplane mode.

It says “Recovery data issue”, and when clicking on Continue it proceeds until it crash everytime at 33%.

Screenshot_20250906-0931571344×2992 119 KB

The .ips file is available here: Pasthis - Simple pastebin

I’m not sure what else would you need to help recover the data?
Is your relative on a beta version? If not, you should post this in the support category, not to Beta Feedback…

posts.name: fr33tux
posts.cooked: Yes, it happens with the tesflight version too.

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked:
I am getting sooooooooooo many crash dialogues please save me pleeeeeeaaaaaaase.

https://debuglogs.org/ios/7.76.0/87266bdcda10ccac6058b8580af4ded8a537e76ba57be7def50595b8a86f3fc9.zip

posts.name: Sasha Weiss
posts.cooked:
Thanks for sharing their IPS file. If they can also submit debug logs, that’d be helpful. (These should be available from the “database issue” sheet that shows when they try and launch, or by tapping 8 times anywhere.)

We’ll take a look as to why the recovery tool is crashing. Unfortunately, in many cases database corruption is not recoverable. It’s a persistent issue that has been extremely difficult to address, which we believe has roots outside of the Signal ecosystem (e.g., in iOS and SQLite interactions), and we’re very sorry it’s happening to them and others.

posts.name: Sasha Weiss
posts.cooked: Sorry about this. We’ve seen the same internally, and are investigating. For the time being we believe they are safe to ignore (and are only shown in the beta population).

posts.name: Sasha Weiss
posts.cooked: While we’d still like to get debug logs to better understand why the tool was crashing, I’ve made a change that will ignore the error for now and hopefully let the recovery complete. I’ll be releasing a new TestFlight build with that change soon. Please have them update once it’s available, and let me know the results.

posts.name: Sasha Weiss
posts.cooked: This should also be addressed in the TestFlight build I plan to release soon.

posts.name: fr33tux
posts.cooked:
Thank you so much!

Here’s the debug logfile (from the non-testflight client): https://debuglogs.org/ios/7.75.0/cf34871bdb67f50e4b281a09dde0437234d45cd5f5ae6763574ef8e1bf524240.zip

I’m waiting to hear back from using the latest .76 version, I’ll let you know shortly.

posts.name: fr33tux
posts.cooked:
Same issue unfortunately: https://debuglogs.org/ios/7.76.0/61a23c15d298021bce216e7d5690645a9ed20a24565a5c26311dc003d8e04ae9.zip

It looks like as if the error is still thrown despite your cide change, it may be raised somewhere else?

posts.name: Sasha Weiss
posts.cooked: Sorry to hear that. It doesn’t look like the same error, but if they’re still crashing it’d be helpful to get a fresh .ips crash file.

posts.name: fr33tux
posts.cooked:
Here’s the new .ips file: Pasthis - Simple pastebin

I really appreciate your support, thank you so much

posts.name: Sasha Weiss
posts.cooked: This is extremely helpful, thank you. I’m hoping to have more changes in this beta, although they may come in the next beta, that I hope will unblock them (and anyone else in their situation).

posts.name: fr33tux
posts.cooked:
Awesome, thank you!

If you need anything else, let me know

posts.name: Sasha Weiss
posts.cooked: The upcoming 7.77 release will have additional changes that we’d love if your contact could test out. If they continue to crash, we’ll need an .ips file. And either way, we’d love to see logs once they’ve updated and tried it out.

Beta testing for this release has concluded. If you find any further bugs related to this release or earlier releases, please report them on GitHub (read How to Report Bugs for more information on how to do that).

If you have feedback specifically related to the new beta version, please post it in the following topic: Beta feedback for the upcoming iOS 7.77 release.
